questions.text: Diagnosis of the xray :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Pilon fracture is the intra-articular fracture of distal tibia as shown in image. Option B-Aviators fracture involves talus Option C-Pott’s fracture is the term used for bimalleolar fracture around ankle Option D-lovers fracture is fracture calcaneum.

questions.text: March fracture involves:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Fracture of 2nd > 3rd metatarsal shaft is k/a March fracture, a type of stress fracture as shown in picture below.

questions.text: Fracture involving both the malleoli is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Cotton`s fracture – trimalleoli fracture. Option B-Pott’s fracture-Bimalleolar fracture. Option C-lover`s fracture-intraarticular fracture of calcaneum. Option D-Pilon fracture is intraarticular distal tibial fracture.

choices.text: Fracture of medial condyle of femur

questions.text: Avascular necrosis is a complication of
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-AVN is a complication of Fracture waist of scaphoid, neck of femur fracture and fracture neck talus due to its vulnerable blood supply. Option B,C,D-Fracture of medial condyle of femur,Olecranon fracture,Radial head fracture do not usually undergo Avascular necrosis.

questions.text: Bohler’s angle is for:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option B-Kite’s angle:- CTEV Option C-Bohler and Gissane angles: Calcaneum fractures

questions.text: Gissane’s angle in intra-articular fracture of Calcaneum is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Xray signs on lateral view of calcaneal fractures (helpful in deciding treatment):- • Bohler’s angle : A decrease in Bohler’s angle indicates collapse of the weight bearing posterior facet . • Gissane’s Angle : An increase in this angle represents the collapse of posterior facet. • Neutral triangle of calcaneum : The triangle is distorted in calcaneal fractures

questions.text: Fracture of Calcaneum is associated most commonly with which of the following:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) M/C mechanism of calcaneal fracture is fall from height, thus M/C fracture associated is vertebral fracture due to landing on ground on feet due to which body weight goes down and ground reaction goes up leading to vertebral fracture.

questions.text: Stress fracture are diagnosed by ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-X ray usually cannot detect stress fracture as they are very small. Option B-CT is also not the preferred modality for stress fracture. Option C-IOC for U/L stress fracture is MRI and for B/L stress fracture is bone scan Option D-bone scan becomes the answer only when B/L is mentioned.

questions.text: Least common complication of fall from height is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Fractures seen in fall from height are due to landing on ground on feet due to which body weight goes down and ground reaction goes up leading to calcaneal fracture, pelvic fracture,vertebral fracture and basilar skull fracture . Hence,Among the given options,Fracture fibula is the least common complication of fall from height.

questions.text: Diagnosis of the given X ray :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) X ray shows fleck sign i.e. increased space between 1st & 2nd metatarsal with chip fracture of 2nd MT base, where Lisfranc ligament is attached,These features are diagnostic of Lisfranc fracture(tarso-metatarsal junction fracture dislocation).

questions.text: Jone’s fracture is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Fracture base of 5th Metatarsal base is Jones fracture. Avulsion fracture due to peroneus brevis tendon pull is pseudo-Jones fracture

questions.text: Tillaux fracture involves:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Anterior tibiofibular ligament is attached to anterior aspect of Lower end of tibia and fibula. Tillaux fracture:-This is avulsion of anterior tibial margin of lower end of tibia by the anterior tibiofibular ligament (Salter Harris type III injury).

choices.text: Avulsion of femoral attachment of MCL
Avulsion of tibia attachment of MCL
Avulsion of femoral attachment of LCL
Avulsion of tibial attachment of LCL

questions.text: Pellegrini-stieda Disease is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Injury at the femoral attachment of MCL(Medial collateral ligament) with new bone formation is called as Pellegrini-stieda Disease as shown in picture below.

questions.text: Toddler fracture involves:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Toddler fracture is seen in children It is also known as CAST (Childhood accidental spiral tibial) fracture. It is minimally displaced spiral/oblique fracture of tibia without fracture of fibula as shown in picture below.

choices.text: Holding club foot in too long corrected position

questions.text: Rocker bottom foot is seen in:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A,B,C-Rocker bottom foot means convex plantar surface. .It May be due to Congenital vertical talus,Arthrogryposis and Holding club foot in too long corrected position. Option D-All of the above

choices.text: Recording the deformity to see improvements serially

questions.text: All of the following are done for management of clubfoot at birth except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A,B,C-Management of CTEV is by Ponsetti technique, where foot is manipulated, serial cast is applied and records of deformity is maintained for follow up. Option D-Posteromedial soft tissue release is not done for management of clubfoot at birth.it is done after 3 years of age.

questions.text: The last deformity to be corrected by Ponsetti method for CTEV is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Sequence of correction is CAVE – Cavus –adduction – varus – equinus. Hence,The last deformity to be corrected by Ponsetti method for CTEV is equinus.

questions.text: The typical deformity in CTEV is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A,B,C-CTEV involves foot,ankle and leg and the deformities are : • Cavus at intertarsal joint ( prominent medial longitudinal arch) • Adduction of forefoot at tarso-metatarsal joint • Varus/inversion at subtalar joint • Equinus at ankle joint Option D-hence,all of the above options are correct.

questions.text: In correction of CTEV, which one of the following deformities resists?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Equinus is the last to correct and most troublesome.

questions.text: These shoes are used in:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) It is foot abduction orthosis (Denis Browne splint) used in CTEV.The Dennis Browne Splint is a specialized orthotic device designed to correct foot positioning in children with congenital deformities, particularly clubfoot. This splint features two padded foot plates connected by a flexible bar, allowing for adjustable positioning of the feet. Its design enables the practitioner to maintain the feet in an abducted and dorsiflexed position, essential for effective correction. The splint is typically recommended following initial treatment, such as casting, to ensure continued alignment as the child grows.

questions.text: In neglected cases of CTEV, joint fused are:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) In neglected cases of CTEV, joint fused are Calcaneocuboid, talonavicular and talocalcaneal. These three joints are fused and is know as “triple arthrodesis”.

questions.text: A newborn child presents with inverted foot and the dorsum of the foot can not touch the anterior tibia. The most probable diagnosis:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Congenital Vertical Talus is a rare congenital condition caused by neuromuscular or chromosomal abnormalities in neonates that typically presents with a rigid flatfoot deformity. Option B-Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita (AMC) is a term used to describe a group of congenital (present at birth) conditions characterized by joint contractures in two or more joints of the body. Therefore, AMC is a descriptive term for over 400 different conditions rather than a single diagnosis. Option C-The test mentioned in which dorsum of the foot can not touch the anterior tibia is dorsiflexion test which can be used as a screening test in newborn children for CTEV. Option D-PES planus also known as flat foot,in this the foot is flat, not inverted.

questions.text: The ideal treatment of bilateral idiopathic Clubfoot in a newborn is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Manipulation is not done by mother,it is done by doctor. Option B-Manipulation and dennis brown splint is not done in newborn.instead,Manipulation and and casts is done in cases of newborn. Option C-Idiopathic club foot is always managed by Ponsetti technique (manipulation and serial casing). However idiopathic clubfoot after 1-2 years age or those secondary to any syndromes ,in these, Ponsetti technique alone is not sufficient. Option D-Surgical release is done after 3 years of age.

choices.text: Foot, ankle, leg and knee joint

questions.text: The club foot characteristically involves:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) CTEV involves foot,ankle and leg and the deformities are : • Cavus at intertarsal joint ( prominent medial longitudinal arch) • Adduction of forefoot at tarso-metatarsal joint • Varus/inversion at subtalar joint • Equinus at ankle joint • medial rotation of distal tibia.

questions.text: Most important pathology in club foot is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Talus is most severely affected and talo- navicular joint complex dislocation is the corner stone of the deformity. Option B-Tightening of Tendoachilles develops secondary to Congenital talonavicular dislocation. Option C-Calcaneal fracture is not seen in club foot. Option D-Lateral derangement is not seen in clubfoot.

questions.text: A cause of comminuted fracture of tibia presenting with severe pain in the calf on dorsiflexion of the foot. There is also numbness on the sole of foot. Distal pulses are present. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Rupture of Achilles tendon do not present with numbness of sole. Option B-Gastrocnemius and soleus muscle tear also do not present with numbness of sole. Option C-It is case of compartment syndrome of leg, specifically posterior compartment.The most common cause of compartment syndrome in children is supracondylar humerus fracture while in adults it is proximal tibia fracture. Overall compartment syndrome is more common in leg and tibia fractures are the commonest cause. Option D-Tarsal tunnel syndrome do not present with severe pain in the calf on dorsiflexion of the foot.

questions.text: Recurrent dislocations are least commonly seen in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Ankle joint is among the least common joints for recurrent dislocation. Overall, dislocation is least common in knee joint.

questions.text: Pipkin’s classification system is used for .
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Fracture femur head-Pipkin’s classification. Option B-Fracture SOF – Winquist classification. Option C-Proximal tibia – Schatzker classification. Option D-calcaneal fracture –Sanders classification.

questions.text: Which among the following is not a feature of Unhappy triad of O’ Donoghue?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) MCL and medial capsular ligament, ACL, Medial meniscus injury, known as unhappy triad of O’Donoghue. Hence,Fibular collateral ligament injury is not a feature of Unhappy triad of O’ Donoghue.

questions.text: Commonest ligament injured in ankle injury?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Lateral ligament complex is the M/C injury, and in the complex,antero-talofibular ligament is the most commonly injured.

questions.text: A-23- year old profession footballer suffered a twisting injury to his right ankle. On examination there is a lot of swelling around the medial malleolus but X- ray doesn’t show any fracture. The structure injured could be?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Since footballer suffered a twisting injury to his right ankle and On examination there is a lot of swelling around the medial malleolus and we know,Deltoid ligament is attached at medial malleolus.hence it could be injured. Option B-Anterior talofibular ligament is the M/C ligament injured overall in ankle sprain but it is attached at lateral malleolus. Option C-Spring ligament is attached between calcaneum and navicular bones. Option D-Tendo Achilles is attached at calcaneum.

questions.text: Identify the abnormality shown in the following picture:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-When Great toe is deviated outward, it is k/a hallux valgus. Option B-When Great toe is deviated inward, it is k/a hallux varus. Option C-Rheumatoid valgus can also cause hallux valgus but there is no history of RA in question. Option D-Subcutaneous nodule usually wont cause deviation of toe.

questions.text: A patient complains of pain in sole on prolonged standing with the following xray, diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Pain in sole with a spur in calcaneum (seen on X-ray) is s/o plantar fasciitis. Option B-A tarsal coalition occurs when two bones grow into one another, connected by a bridge of bone, cartilage, or strong, fibrous tissue. Option C-Ankylosing spondylitis usuallyaffects axial skeleton but it can also cause enthesitis leading to pain in sole. Option D-Calcaneal old healed fracture wont cause bony spurs.

questions.text: Following are principles in the treatment of compound fractures except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Wound debridement is done to remove all necrotic tissues. Option B-Immediate wound closure is never the treatment protocol in compound/open fractures. Although with plastic surgery assistance, a skin graft/flap may be done at the same sitting after thorough wound debridement. Option C-tendon repair is done to maintain functionality of muscles. Option D-aggressive antibiotic therapy to prevent infections.

questions.text: Cast syndrome is a complication of:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Hip spica or scoliosis cast is applied around abdomen and hence it can press on superior mesenteric artery ,compressing 3rd part of duodenum, known as cast syndrome. However, all types of cast can complicate into compartment syndrome if applied in acute injury / presence of swelling. Option B,C,D-they are applied on upper or lower limb and not on abdomen,hence they can`t cause cast syndrome.

questions.text: Traction not used in lower limb:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A,B-Gallows / Bryants for SOF fracture(Child Option C-Dunlop traction is used in supracondylar fracture humerus Option C-Perkins traction for adult SOF fracture.

choices.text: Does not look like a normal foot

questions.text: Regarding SACH foot, all are true except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-SACH foot has a solid ankle cushion heel Option B-It is a prosthetic device. Option C-SACH foot has a solid ankle cushion heel which inhibits active plantar/dorsiflexion of ankle and thus squatting is not possible with SACH foot, but possible with Jaipur foot. Option D-it do not look like a normal foot.

questions.text: Jaipur foot was invented by?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Jaipur foot was invented by Dr Pramod karna sethi
